snippet: Hogg says that in Eskdalemuir, out of 20,000 sheep"none were left alive but forty young wedders on one farm, and five oldewes on another.

title: Song and scenery;
author: Moffat, James C.
snippet: N active pedestrian, who walks not on principle and for exercise, but because he takes pleasure in the use of his limbs, may enjoy an exhilarating- ramble  among the upper waters of the Teviot, and over the hills, into the wilds of Westkirk, or of Eskdalemuir.

title: Reminiscences of Yarrow. Edited and annotated by ... Professor Veitch, LL.D. Illustrated by Tom Scott ... Second edition
author: Russell, James
snippet: His letter just forestalledby a day one from JMr Johnstone of Alva, the secondheritor in the parish, in favour of Dr Brown, who,disappointed of Yarrow, was soon after presentedby the Crown to Eskdalemuir, and thus became aneighbour and very warm friend of my father's tillthe day of the Doctor's death.
